questions.ocrQuestion:
A bomb explodes on the moon. You will hear its sound on earth after:
a. \( 10 \mathrm{~min} \)
b. 2 hour \( 18 \mathrm{~min} \)
c. \( 37 \mathrm{~min} \)
d. never
questions.onlyq_text: A bomb explodes on the moon. You will hear its sound on earth after:
questions.subject: PHYSICS

questions.ocrQuestion:
If \( c_{0} \) and \( c \) denote the sound velocity and root mean square velocity of molecules in a gas, then:
a. \( c_{0}>c \)
b. \( c_{0}=c \)
c. \( c_{0}=c(\gamma / 3)^{1 / 2} \)
d. \( c_{0} \) and \( c \) are not related
questions.onlyq_text: If \( c_{0} \) and \( c \) denote the sound velocity and root mean square velocity of molecules in a gas, then:

options.option: d. \( c_{0} \) and \( c \) are not related

questions.sol_html: (c) \( C_{0}=\sqrt{\frac{\gamma R T}{m}} \) and \( C=\sqrt{\frac{3 R T}{M}} \)\[\frac{C_{0}}{C}=\sqrt{\frac{\gamma}{3}} \text { or } C_{0}=\sqrt{\frac{\gamma}{3}} C\]
questions.subject: PHYSICS

questions.ocrQuestion:
A transverse wave is described by the equation \( y=y_{0} \sin 2 \pi\left(f t-\frac{x}{\lambda}\right) \). The maximum particle velocity is equal to four times the wave velocity if:
a. \( \lambda=\frac{\pi y_{0}}{4} \)
b. \( \lambda=\frac{\pi y_{0}}{2} \)
c. \( \lambda=\pi y_{0} \)
d. \( \lambda=2 \pi y_{0} \)
questions.onlyq_text: A transverse wave is described by the equation \( y=y_{0} \sin 2 \pi\left(f t-\frac{x}{\lambda}\right) \). The maximum particle velocity is equal to four times the wave velocity if:
questions.sol_html: (b) \( y=y_{0} \sin 2 \pi\left(f t-\frac{x}{\lambda}\right) \)Wave velocity \( v=f_{A} \)Particle velocity \( u=\frac{d y}{d t}=y_{0} \cdot 2 \pi f \cos 2 \pi\left(f t-\frac{\pi}{\lambda}\right) \)\[\begin{array}{l}u_{\max }=y_{0} \cdot 2 \pi f \\\text { Given } u_{\max }=4 v \\y_{0} 2 \pi f=4 f_{\lambda} \Rightarrow \lambda=\frac{\pi y_{0}}{2}\end{array}\]
questions.subject: PHYSICS
